blog.name: fedonciadale
blog.title: FedonCiadale
blog.description: Fantasy aficionado since I read Tolkien in my teenage years. I still love Tolkien but I am also into other works. I love ASOIAF (books) and GoT (Show). I also like Brandon Sanderson, Lois McMaster Bujold, in short in my free time it's fantasy...Header by courtesy of ragekitn!

summary: To go South - chapter 43 - What the gods want
title: To go South - chapter 43 - What the gods want
body:
Creative juices are still flowing and I’m determined to finish before season 8 starts… My long slow-burn fic. Bran makes battle plans. I guess people won’t be happy about his plans…. Also on AO3.

Sansa wondered if the war council was too big. Too many different voices could lead to lengthy discussions, discussions they had no time for. She had ordered hot tea to be prepared for Bran who was still pale as a sheet, although the sharing of visions with Daenerys had been hours ago. Worry for Bran who shared so little of his worries gnawed at her heart.

Sansa surpressed the anger at Daenerys that filled her. Bran had offered her visions and she had taken them but had refused to learn what Bran cared about. Anger would not lead her anywhere though.

She had arranged several tables in a circle, so that there would be no question of who led this council. She could not afford to get into a fight about status with Daenerys and she could not afford to bend too much to Jon’s aunt. She felt like she was trying to walk on a frozen lake with thin ice. Walk too slow and she would break in, walk too fast and she would slip. She was glad, Ghost was at her feet. She did feel safer with the wolf at her side. Ghost pressed to her side, his warmth a constant reminder that he would protect her, that Jon would protect her. Surely Ghost would know, if Jon was in danger. Sansa was tempted to touch her belly, but instead she pressed her thumb on the fabric of her sleeves, the place where she had stitched small snowflakes into the seam. It calmed her. I survived Littlefinger, I am going to survive Daenerys. The lords came one after the other and the hall filled.

Daenerys joined them after she had briefly conferred with her Hand, and the tables in a circle worked as Sansa had intended. The dragon queen did not fight about the seating. Her face held a small smile that made Sansa uncomfortable and it frightened her far more than the viscious remarks Daenerys had pointed at her yesterday. Tyrion looked hung over, but as soon as he had taken a seat he reached for his goblet. Arya pointedly rose, when Daenerys had taken a seat and sat as far away from Daenerys as possible. She dragged Gendry with her.

Daenerys raised an eyebrow at Arya, smiling sweetly.

“Who is this young man?”, she asked. “Surely only Lords are allowed to sit in council?”

Sansa shot Arya a warning look, and thankfully Arya did not answer, although she blushed heavily, if in anger or embarrassment, Sansa could not have said.

“Gendry knows all about Valyrian steel,” she claimed quickly. “His experience is sorely needed.” He is a blacksmith. He must at least know some things about Valyrian steel. She wished Arya would have had the sense not to bring him, where Daenerys could see him. To Sansa the similarity was obvious, and she had noticed that Jaime had narrowed his eyes at Gendry, but not many people knew that Gendry was the late King Robert’s son. I must remember to tell everyone who knows to keep silent about this.

Bran held his cup in both hands. Even covered in fur, he looked as if he was cold. And tired.

“Jon will arrive soon, but we best start. He knows much of what I’m going to say.” His voice sounded flat.

“Why do you open the council?”, Daenerys asked.

Sansa was about to choose the right words to reprimand her, but Bran was faster.

“If anyone is here who knows more about magic than I do, I’d gladly resign.”

Daenerys eyes glittered, but she held her mouth.

“Make no mistake, the White Walkers come, and this will be our last stand. Here at Winterfell the fate of the world is decided.”

Bran drew a deep breath. “I must start with what we know about our enemy. Many of you are familiar with the tales of the Long Night, but not all, and the old tales might give us a clue.”

Sansa felt fatigue overcome her, when Bran told them the stories she had known since childhood. Old Nan had made the stories much more interesting. To hear them in Bran’s almost emotionless voice robbed them of their colour and vividness. Still, it would not be good to fall asleep. That would really be inappropriate. She wondered if she should ask Maester Wolkan for something against her tiredness. It probably had to do with the pregnancy.

Bran had just finished the story of how the children of the forest had helped the last hero, when Brienne entered with Jon. Sansa was wide awake in a second and stood immediately. Jon closed in in quick strides and took her in his arms. Her heart hammered. He will be so happy about the baby.

We’re about to be besieged and I’m just happy, he is here. We’re on the eve of destruction, but my heart is full of joy. She separated herself from his arms. It would not do to show too much affection. She hoped that Daenerys had not seen more, than a dutiful husband greeting his wife. She could feel the blood rush to her face, when she saw Jon’s eyes glitter and his smile that warmed her heart.

The other lords had rosen as well, Jaime Lannister had been the first. Sansa saw that he had managed to block Daenerys’ from seeing them. Gods bless him.

Jon nodded friendly to the Lords, and made a small gesture with his hand, and they sat again. He spotted Daenerys, who had remained seated.

He gave the slightest indication of a bow.

“Aunt,” he said. “I am glad you came to join the fight for the living.” I doubt she came for that, but it such a nice way to put that.

Daenerys studied him for a long uncomfortable moment.

“I know my duty to my people”, she answered.

Jon took a seat beside Sansa. He bent down and briefly petted Ghost. When his head was under the table, he rolled his eyes, so Sansa could see. She pressed her thumb on her sleeve to keep from sniggering. When he bent back, his hand touched hers and he pressed it, all too shortly.

“Please continue, Bran, there is little time for exchanging pleasentries. The enemy closes in.”

“The children of the forest had a reason to help the First men the last time.” Bran picked up his reasoning, seemingly unimpressed by the tension in the room.

Sansa thought she could hear that his voice was not flat like before, but somewhat pressed.

“When I went back in time to see, I saw that the children of the Forest made the White Walkers.”

Bran’s statement led to a collective outbreak of astonished questions. Sansa herself barely caught herself from jumping up again.

Bran raised a hand. “The King has it right. There is little time. Just listen, questions can be asked later.”

“The Children wanted to drive off the First Men who had come with their axes and had cut into the forests to build their houses. They made the White Walkers as a weapon against the humans, but to do that, they had given them life or some sort of life, by misusing their water magic. The White Walkers are ice, born of ice magic, an abomination.”

“They do not have life of their own, they syphon their life away from the children. That is why the children at last were so desperate that they helped us humans to defeat the White Walkers. They made a pact with us humans, here at the very weirwood of Winterfell, where Winter fell after the Long Night. They armed the humans with dragon glass, the wall was built, and the ice magic was contained, but it stayed on. It was in the world. The scales of the world were out of balance.”

He waved to Maester Wolkan who put a tiny scale on the table, just in front of Bran. Bran pulled one of the scale pans, and the other went up.

“This caused the creation of fire magic, or probably more accurately the increase of fire magic. The existence of the White Walkers made it possible that the Valyrians used fire magic.”

Bran let the scales swing, and they swung wildly.

“The scales came to rest once more, when Valyria fell, but about fourty to fifty years ago, the scales were tipped again. I’ve talked with Tormund,…” Bran nodded briefly at the wildling who sat at the table. “…. and he agrees that the White Walkers came back around that time. Their strength has gained momentum ever since.”

He tipped at the scales again. Sansa shuddered. She wondered what had instigated the White Walkers awakening. She looked at her brother who responded with an intense gaze, that seemed to say ‘Don’t ask’.

Fifty years. That must have been the reign of Aegon the Unlikely. Summerhall? Aegon wanted to wake dragons? And he woke ice instead? Sansa was puzzled. Why does Bran keep silent about this? A fist of fear clutched her heart. Her eyes met Arya’s, and on her face she saw the same puzzlement.

“What does that mean for us?” Jon asked.

“It means that the children want us to reduce the might of the White Walkers, so that their life force flows back into the river of life that sustains them. Our recent victory has given them back more power, I can feel what they want, when I touch the weirwood. They want us to use fire and dragons to defeat them and bring the children back and enter a new pact with them.”

They want us…. What do you want Bran?

Bran took his time and looked them all in the eyes. “It means we have to fight the White Walkers and to defeat them, we have to use the dragons and the wildfire and everything we have. I will have to call the Kings of Winter again. Then the children will come back. It means, we have to lure the White Walkers into a fiery trap, right here where the last hero took his stand the last time. It means, we have to give up Winterfell.”
body_abstract:
Creative juices are still flowing and I’m determined to finish before season 8 starts… My long slow-burn fic. Bran makes battle plans. I guess people won’t be happy about his plans…. Also on AO3.

Sansa wondered if the war council was too big. Too many different voices could lead to lengthy discussions, discussions they had no time for. She had ordered hot tea to be prepared for Bran who was still pale as a sheet, although the sharing of visions with Daenerys had been hours ago. Worry for Bran who shared so little of his worries gnawed at her heart.

I must remember to tell everyone who knows to keep silent about this.

Bran held his cup in both hands. Even covered in fur, he looked as if he was cold. And tired.

“Jon will arrive soon, but we best start. He knows much of what I’m going to say.” His voice sounded flat.

“Why do you open the council?”, Daenerys asked.

Sansa was about to choose the right words to reprimand her, but Bran was faster.

“If anyone is here who knows more about magic than I do, I’d gladly resign.”

Daenerys eyes glittered, but she held her mouth.

“Make no mistake, the White Walkers come, and this will be our last stand. Here at Winterfell the fate of the world is decided.”

Bran drew a deep breath. “I must start with what we know about our enemy. Many of you are familiar with the tales of the Long Night, but not all, and the old tales might give us a clue.”

Sansa felt fatigue overcome her, when Bran told them the stories she had known since childhood. Old Nan had made the stories much more interesting. To hear them in Bran’s almost emotionless voice robbed them of their colour and vividness. Still, it would not be good to fall asleep. That would really be inappropriate. She wondered if she should ask Maester Wolkan for something against her tiredness. It probably had to do with the pregnancy.

Bran had just finished the story of how the children of the forest had helped the last hero, when Brienne entered with Jon. Sansa was wide awake in a second and stood immediately. Jon closed in in quick strides and took her in his arms. Her heart hammered. He will be so happy about the baby.

We’re about to be besieged and I’m just happy, he is here. We’re on the eve of destruction, but my heart is full of joy. She separated herself from his arms. It would not do to show too much affection. She hoped that Daenerys had not seen more, than a dutiful husband greeting his wife. She could feel the blood rush to her face, when she saw Jon’s eyes glitter and his smile that warmed her heart.

The other lords had rosen as well, Jaime Lannister had been the first. Sansa saw that he had managed to block Daenerys’ from seeing them. Gods bless him.

Jon nodded friendly to the Lords, and made a small gesture with his hand, and they sat again. He spotted Daenerys, who had remained seated.

He gave the slightest indication of a bow.

“Aunt,” he said. “I am glad you came to join the fight for the living.” I doubt she came for that, but it such a nice way to put that.

Daenerys studied him for a long uncomfortable moment.

“I know my duty to my people”, she answered.

Jon took a seat beside Sansa. He bent down and briefly petted Ghost. When his head was under the table, he rolled his eyes, so Sansa could see. She pressed her thumb on her sleeve to keep from sniggering. When he bent back, his hand touched hers and he pressed it, all too shortly.

“Please continue, Bran, there is little time for exchanging pleasentries. The enemy closes in.”

“The children of the forest had a reason to help the First men the last time.” Bran picked up his reasoning, seemingly unimpressed by the tension in the room.

Sansa thought she could hear that his voice was not flat like before, but somewhat pressed.

“When I went back in time to see, I saw that the children of the Forest made the White Walkers.”

Bran’s statement led to a collective outbreak of astonished questions. Sansa herself barely caught herself from jumping up again.

Bran raised a hand. “The King has it right. There is little time. Just listen, questions can be asked later.”

“The Children wanted to drive off the First Men who had come with their axes and had cut into the forests to build their houses. They made the White Walkers as a weapon against the humans, but to do that, they had given them life or some sort of life, by misusing their water magic. The White Walkers are ice, born of ice magic, an abomination.”

“They do not have life of their own, they syphon their life away from the children. That is why the children at last were so desperate that they helped us humans to defeat the White Walkers. They made a pact with us humans, here at the very weirwood of Winterfell, where Winter fell after the Long Night. They armed the humans with dragon glass, the wall was built, and the ice magic was contained, but it stayed on. It was in the world. The scales of the world were out of balance.”

He waved to Maester Wolkan who put a tiny scale on the table, just in front of Bran. Bran pulled one of the scale pans, and the other went up.

“This caused the creation of fire magic, or probably more accurately the increase of fire magic. The existence of the White Walkers made it possible that the Valyrians used fire magic.”

Bran let the scales swing, and they swung wildly.

“The scales came to rest once more, when Valyria fell, but about fourty to fifty years ago, the scales were tipped again. I’ve talked with Tormund,…” Bran nodded briefly at the wildling who sat at the table. “…. and he agrees that the White Walkers came back around that time. Their strength has gained momentum ever since.”

He tipped at the scales again. Sansa shuddered. She wondered what had instigated the White Walkers awakening. She looked at her brother who responded with an intense gaze, that seemed to say ‘Don’t ask’.

Fifty years. That must have been the reign of Aegon the Unlikely. Summerhall? Aegon wanted to wake dragons? And he woke ice instead? Sansa was puzzled. Why does Bran keep silent about this? A fist of fear clutched her heart. Her eyes met Arya’s, and on her face she saw the same puzzlement.

“What does that mean for us?” Jon asked.

“It means that the children want us to reduce the might of the White Walkers, so that their life force flows back into the river of life that sustains them. Our recent victory has given them back more power, I can feel what they want, when I touch the weirwood. They want us to use fire and dragons to defeat them and bring the children back and enter a new pact with them.”

They want us…. What do you want Bran?

Bran took his time and looked them all in the eyes. “It means we have to fight the White Walkers and to defeat them, we have to use the dragons and the wildfire and everything we have. I will have to call the Kings of Winter again. Then the children will come back. It means, we have to lure the White Walkers into a fiery trap, right here where the last hero took his stand the last time. It means, we have to give up Winterfell.”
trail.content_abstract:
Creative juices are still flowing and I’m determined to finish before season 8 starts… My long slow-burn fic. Bran makes battle plans. I guess people won’t be happy about his plans…. Also on AO3.

Sansa wondered if the war council was too big. Too many different voices could lead to lengthy discussions, discussions they had no time for. She had ordered hot tea to be prepared for Bran who was still pale as a sheet, although the sharing of visions with Daenerys had been hours ago. Worry for Bran who shared so little of his worries gnawed at her heart.

tags: it’s not anti but i don’t have the energy
summary: GOT Trailer - What Didn’t We See?
body:
GOT Trailer - What Didn’t We See?

By now, everyone has gone over every millisecond of the new S8 Game of Thrones trailer with a fine tooth comb (if you’re looking for a quality analysis, both @fortunatelylori and @thelawyerthatwaspromised have great break downs of the trailer). So I won’t add my voice to the mix in regards to what was included in the trailer, but I did want to discuss what wasn’t included.

As expected, the trailer was tightly edited. We were given very little that wasn’t set up the previous season and as many have already discussed, the trailer seems to focus on the first three episodes and the battle with the White Walkers. I know some people dismiss the importance of GOT trailers, but on the whole, they do tend to tell a cohesive story in relation to each season’s narrative arc. Therefore, you can tell just as much by what is omitted from the trailer as to what is included, especially when the expected is missing.

So what was missing from the trailer that the audience expected to see, especially in light of S7?

1. Daenerys and her dragons missing from the White Walker battle.

At the end of S7, Daenerys, her dragons and her army were heading North to “save” it from the approaching Army of the Dead. Jon (and the majority of the GA) is convinced that the dragons are key to defeating the Night King (while the dragons have the potential to be effective in thinning out the wights, the White Walkers are immune to fire). So like @jonsalways asked, where is Daenerys? I expected a token shot of her riding Drogon, a dragon breathing fire and destroying wights - something that demonstrated her self-appointed role as saviour of the North. Instead, we have have Daenerys arriving at Winterfell, approaching Jon in the crypts, visiting her dragons and being very pretty and apprehensive in Winterfell. Which is an odd decision, because Daenerys role in defeating the Army of the Dead is taken as canon by some viewers, so a shot of her atop Drogon is not only expected, but it gives absolutely nothing away. So why isn’t she there?

2. Where is Bran and Tyrion?

Both Bran and Tyrion appear only once in the trailer. Bran in the first 30 seconds and Tyrion in the last 30 seconds. Considering their narrative importance, their omission from the battle with the White Walkers is pretty conspicuous. Bran has spent seven seasons preparing for this moment, and while many are placing their bets of Daenerys being the key to defeating the Night King, my money is on Bran. Therefore it makes sense to play down Bran’s importance, only to blindside the audience with how Bran is integral in defeating the Night King.

Tyrion’s absence from the battle is expected. He is Hand of the Queen and not expected to take up arms. But Tyrion is also absent (at least from the brief shots from the trailer) from where he is expected to be - either with Davos pacing the battlements or in the crypts with Varys. So why wasn’t he shown? Is he no longer in Winterfell?

3. Where is Sansa?

Sansa’s absence from the battle is also expected, and while it could indicate absolutely nothing, I was surprised that Sansa wasn’t shown waiting out the battle in the crypts with Varys (similar to her waiting out the siege of Kings Landing with Cersei in S2). Instead, they chose two shots of Sansa looking concerned - both of which followed (coincidentally I’m sure) a Jon and Daenerys scene.

4. Oh Theon, where art thou?

S7 ended with Theon on his way to rescue Yara from Euron’s clutches. Therefore I think it’s unlikely that he will play a part in the fight against the Army of the Dead and his absence isn’t that odd. I tend to think that he’ll play a bigger part in the second half of the season, so the question isn’t why wasn’t he featured, but what will role be after he succeeds/fails in rescuing Yara?

Cause where was he the whole trailer!!!

blog.name: theladymeera
blog.title: I'm So Salty I'm a Pickle
blog.description:
Daenerys was my first fave and she will be my last.

Danielle, US. Meera is the frog queen of my heart but I post more about my dragon queen Dany. Trying to be a happy person against the will of all these nihilistic men.

This is my ASOIAF/GOT side blog. My main is a-mountain-girl, my booklr is readingaway.

tags: at least he was in the promo material
but now i'm hurting all over again about meera being written off the sho
excuse me i need to go cry again
summary: Me, eternally: where’s my son? where’s my son? where’s my son? where’s my son?  *2 milisecond clip of Bran looking exactly the...
body:
Me, eternally: where’s my son? where’s my son? where’s my son? where’s my son? 

*2 milisecond clip of Bran looking exactly the same as he has for the last two seasons appears*

Me: THERE HE IS!!!!

blog.name: thecollection101universe
blog.title: Screw This
blog.description: I'm a slut for high fantasy, sci fi and character development.

summary: I know this is a reach (but i’m still desperately trying to somehow connect theon to the trailer lol) but do you guys think it’s...
body: I know this is a reach (but i’m still desperately trying to somehow connect theon to the trailer lol) but do you guys think it’s possible that it’s theon bran is talking to? think about it: “Everything you’ve done has led you here, where you belong; home” most people think he’s saying it to jon but why would he be? jon doesn’t need to be “led” home, he’s already lived there and considered it his home his whole life. if theon were to make it back to winterfell, i would 100% expect there to be a scene with him and bran, and this quote could be a reference to his acceptance into the stark family?? the “everything you’ve done” thing just makes me think of him okay think about it
